data.title: Sarah Silverman tour 2024: Here’s how to get tickets under $60 to her NYC comedy shows
authors: Nicole Iuzzolino | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
data.meta_description: She will begin her comedy tour on Sept. 19 in St. Louis
data.text:
Sarah Silverman is heading out on a 30 city U.S. tour this fall, which means you need tickets.

The “Sarah Silverman: Postmortem” comedy tour will begin on Sept. 19 in St. Louis and will wrap up on Jan. 25 in Boston.

Towards the end of the tour, the comedian will perform two shows in New York City at the Beacon Theatre on Jan. 17-18, 2025.

“Looking forward to hitting the road and connecting with human beings in a live setting,” Silverman said in a statement.

Fans should be aware that upon arrival to the arena she is performing in, all phones and smart watches will be secured in Yondr pouches that will be unlocked at the end of the show.

Fans can find tickets for Sarah Silverman’s comedy tour on Vivid Seats, StubHub, TicketCity, SeatGeek and Ticketmaster.

The cheapest ticket at the time of publication for her comedy show in New York City on Jan. 17 is $59 on Vivid Seats.

For her Jan. 18 show, the cheapest ticket at the time of publication before fees is $59 on Vivid Seats.

If you are struggling to secure tickets in the right price point or your preferred seating section on StubHub, you can find some tips and tricks here.

First-time Vivid Seats users can save $20 on ticket orders over $200 by entering promo code NJ20 at checkout.

You can find a full calendar of Sarah Silverman’s tour dates here.

Upcoming 2024 comedy tours

Sarah Silverman is not the only comedian heading out on tour this year.

Here are a few you don’t want to miss out on: Sebastian Maniscalco, Impractical Jokers, Steve Martin and Martin Short and Matt Rife.
